source.entity: Tatar scientist and writer Gali Rahim

justifications: Rahim attributes significant roles to various spirits and deities in shamanism.
Ancient Turkic inscriptions and symbolic artifacts depict her as a protective figure for children.
Teleut pagans represented her as a silver-haired, young woman who descended from heaven on a rainbow to guard children.

target.topic: Erlik as the ruler of the underworld

justifications: Erlik presides over the realm of the dead from a palace of black mud or blue-black iron.
Erlik's breath was believed to paralyze anyone who inhaled it.
Al Basty, evil female spirits, were believed to cause illnesses and nightmares.
Zhalmauyz Kempir is described as a creature with seven heads and an appetite for human flesh.
Kudai and Erlik had a dispute over who was the mightiest creator.
After the dispute, Kudai won and became the creator of humanity.
